title: Easeout Weekly #26
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![Mirage Logo](/images/uploads/mirage-js.png) [Don’t Wait! Mock the API](https://css-tricks.com/dont-wait-mock-the-api/) Mocking allows you to simulate the API without (ideally) changing the front end. This article looks at what a good API mocking should look like and how to implement a mocked API into a new or existing application. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/dont-wait-mock-the-api/)
![Better Error Handling In NodeJS Article Card](/images/uploads/error-handling-nodejs-error-classes.png) [Better Error Handling In NodeJS With Error Classes](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/error-handling-nodejs-error-classes/) Kelvin Omereshone explains the "error" class pattern and how to use it for a better, more efficient way of handling errors across your applications. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/error-handling-nodejs-error-classes/)
![Color Palette](/images/uploads/paletton-application-color-schemes-css-custom-properties.png) [How To Configure Application Color Schemes With CSS Custom Properties](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/application-color-schemes-css-custom-properties/) In this article, Artur Basak introduces a modern approach on how to set up CSS Custom Properties that respond to the application colors. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/application-color-schemes-css-custom-properties/)
![Serverless Article Card](/images/uploads/smashing-podcast-episode-22.png) [Smashing Podcast Episode 22 With Chris Coyier: What Is Serverless?](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/smashing-podcast-episode-22/) e’re talking about Serverless architectures. What does that mean, and how does it differ from how we might build sites currently? Drew McLellan talks to Chris Coyier to find out. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/smashing-podcast-episode-22/)
![Chrome DevTools](/images/uploads/a11y-tree.png) [Accessibility In Chrome DevTools](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/accessibility-chrome-devtools/) This article will demonstrate some useful features in DevTools which can help you improve the accessibility of your website. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/accessibility-chrome-devtools/)
![Library of Alexandria ](/images/uploads/libraryofalexandria.png) [Web History: Browsers](https://css-tricks.com/chapter-2-browsers/) A fantastic deep dive into web history with Jay Hoffman - this chapter takes a look at web browsers. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/chapter-2-browsers/)
![Table of data example](/images/uploads/user-table.jpg) [Practical Use Cases for JavaScript’s closest() Method](https://css-tricks.com/practical-use-cases-for-javascripts-closest-method/) Have you ever had the problem of finding the parent of a DOM node in JavaScript, but aren’t sure *how many levels* you have to traverse up to get to it? Let's fix this with the new Element.closest() method. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/practical-use-cases-for-javascripts-closest-method/)
![Web App Lesson Example](/images/uploads/4-lessons-web-app-designers-can-learn-from-google-2.jpg) [4 Lessons Web App Designers Can Learn From Google](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/lessons-web-app-designers-learn-google/) There’s a reason why Google dominates market share for things like search engines, web browsers, email clients and cloud storage services. If there’s one company whose product features you should be mirroring, it’s Google. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/lessons-web-app-designers-learn-google/)
![Smashing Product Offering](/images/uploads/pdf-checklists-smart-interface-design-patterns.png) [Community Resources, Weekly Newsletter, And Boosting Skills Online](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/monthly-roundup-08-2020/) Smashing magazine has been through a good number of changes in the past: a new design, a new layout, a new technical stack, and so much more. This article sums up what happening with this wonderful resource! [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/monthly-roundup-08-2020/)
![SEO Article Card](/images/uploads/smashing-guide-search-engine-optimization.png) [A Smashing Guide To The World Of Search Engine Optimization](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/smashing-guide-search-engine-optimization/) SEO is an ever-changing world. Blink and you’ll miss the latest best practices, thought leaders, and tools. Feeling out of touch is natural. This guide is your way back into the groove, baby. Read it ➡️
![Shoptalk Logo](/images/uploads/shoptalk.png) [Tailwind, Where to Find Inspiration, SVG Corrections, and Web Workers](https://shoptalkshow.com/425/) A look at Tailwind CSS, getting overwhelmed with where to start on a project, some follow up on SVG sizes and web components, and why isn't there a bigger focus on web workers? [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/425/)
![Lightbulb Pink](/images/uploads/lighbulbs-in-squares.png) [What I Learned by Fixing One Line of CSS in an Open Source Project](https://css-tricks.com/what-i-learned-by-fixing-one-line-of-css-in-an-open-source-project/) I was browsing the [Svelte](https://svelte.dev/) docs on my iPhone and came across a blaring UI bug. The notch in the REPL knob was totally out of whack. I’m always looking to contribute to open source, and I thought this would be a quick and easy fix. Turns out, there was a lot more to it than just changing one line of CSS. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/what-i-learned-by-fixing-one-line-of-css-in-an-open-source-project/)

short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
